tl.GUI

Interface TGUIInterface

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    TIGUICollection, TIGUIScrollable, TIGUISelectable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TButton, TButtonToggle, TContainer, TGUI, TGUIComponent, TLabel, TLabelExtended, TListBox, TListBoxDrop, TListBoxDropGen, TListBoxGen, TSlider, TTextBox

    public interface TGUIInterface
    TGUIInterface is the main interface for all TGUIComponents.
    It provides TGUIComponents the ability to update(draw, etc.) and to accept input commands.
    The functions provided are to be used in conjunction with Slick2D's update/render/command functions.
    Since:
    1.5
    Author:
    Callum Nichols
    See Also:
    TGUIComponent

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void keyPressed(int key, char c)
      Used to update upon a keyboard button being pressed down.
      Is usually called before keyReleased(int key, char c);
      void keyReleased(int key, char c)
      Used to update upon a keyboard button being released.
      Is usually called after keyPressed(int key, char c);
      void mousePressed(int button, int x, int y)
      Used to update upon a mouse button being pressed down.
      Is usually called before mouseReleased(int button, int x, int y).
      void mouseReleased(int button, int x, int y)
      Used to update upon a mouse button being released.
      Is usually called after mousePressed(int button, int x, int y).
      void mouseWheelMoved(int change)
      Used to update upon the middle mouse wheel being scrolled in any direction.
      void update(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics graphics)
      The main update function used to update and draw the TGUI component.
      It takes a Graphics object to draw on.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        void update(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics graphics)
        The main update function used to update and draw the TGUI component.
        It takes a Graphics object to draw on.
        Parameters:
        graphics - - The graphics context on which to draw the TGUIComponent

      • mousePressed

        void mousePressed(int button,
                int x,
                int y)
        Used to update upon a mouse button being pressed down.
        Is usually called before mouseReleased(int button, int x, int y).
        Parameters:
        button - - The button ID that is being pressed. 0 - LMB, 1 - RMB, 2 - MMB
        x - - The x co-ordinate that the button was pressed on.
        y - - The y co-ordinate that the button was pressed on.
        See Also:
        mouseReleased(int, int, int)

      • mouseReleased

        void mouseReleased(int button,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Used to update upon a mouse button being released.
        Is usually called after mousePressed(int button, int x, int y).
        Parameters:
        button - - The button ID that is being pressed. 0 - LMB, 1 - RMB, 2 - MMB
        x - - The x co-ordinate that the button was pressed on.
        y - - The y co-ordinate that the button was pressed on.
        See Also:
        mousePressed(int, int, int)

      • mouseWheelMoved

        void mouseWheelMoved(int change)
        Used to update upon the middle mouse wheel being scrolled in any direction.
        Parameters:
        change - - The length in degrees that the mouse wheel moved. 0-360 = north, 0--360 = south

      • keyPressed

        void keyPressed(int key,
              char c)
        Used to update upon a keyboard button being pressed down.
        Is usually called before keyReleased(int key, char c);
        Parameters:
        key - - The keyboard button ID that is being pressed.
        c - - The character that the keyboard button represents (if any).
        See Also:
        keyReleased(int, char)

      • keyReleased

        void keyReleased(int key,
               char c)
        Used to update upon a keyboard button being released.
        Is usually called after keyPressed(int key, char c);
        Parameters:
        key - - The keyboard button ID that is being pressed.
        c - - The character that the keyboard button represents (if any).
        See Also:
        keyPressed(int, char)
